business.headline: Sensex, Nifty open higher driven by auto, metal stocks as FMCG continues to fallThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 172.34 points to 85,360.94, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 44.10 points to 26,190.65 as of 9:26 am.

Gold, silver price today: How have precious metals started 2026?Gold and silver prices moved higher on Friday, recovering part of the losses seen late last week, even as investors looked back at the historic gains these metals delivered through 2025.

Is 10-minute delivery really unsafe? Zomato CEO answers after gig workers strikeWhile delivery services on platforms such as Zomato and Blinkit were largely unaffected on New Year's Eve, questions around whether 10-minute delivery models put pressure on riders gained traction on social media.

If system was unfair...: Deepinder Goyal as Zomato unaffected by gig workers' strikeZomato and its quick-commerce arm Blinkit recorded their highest-ever single-day orders on New Year's Eve, delivering over 75 lakh orders despite a nationwide gig workers' strike. Founder and CEO Deepinder Goyal said such scale shows a system seen as unfair cannot consistently attract or retain workers.

Special Report: India's Economy Faces Trump Tariffs and Trade Impasse Entering 2026In this Special Report, an unidentified speaker analyses the state of the Indian economy as the nation steps into 2026. While highlighting a 'stupendous 2025' marked by major reforms like GST simplification and the Jan Vishwas Bill, the report warns that India enters the new year 'playing on a strong economic pitch, but also on a sticky wicket'. Key challenges identified include the ongoing trade impasse with the US, punitive 'Trump tariffs' of 50%, and a depreciating rupee which breached the 91 mark against the dollar. The programme notes that while GDP growth remains robust at 8%, high food inflation and sluggish job creation persist. With five state elections due in 2026, the report also flags concerns over rising state debts due to populist spending, even as all eyes turn to the upcoming Union Budget in February to restore confidence and boost private investment.

Commercial LPG cylinder price hiked by Rs 111 on New Year, highest since June 2025On New Year's Day, the price of a 19-kg commercial LPG cylinder was increased by Rs 111 — the steepest hike in six months, — with effect from today. The price of a 14.2-kg domestic LPG cylinder, however, remains unchanged.
Sensex, Nifty end lower as ITC, Godfrey Phillipss crash on tobacco cess moveThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 32 points to close at 85,188.60, while the NSE Nifty50 was up by 16.95 points to end at 26,146.55.

Silver vs gold vs stock vs real estate: What can deliver most gains in 2026Should it be gold, which has just seen its strongest year since 1979? Or silver, which has surged over 150%, marking one of its best-ever annual performances?

Inside draft labour code rules. What the fine print says on wages, working hoursThe draft Rules relate to the Code on Wages, the Code on Social Security, the Industrial Relations Code and the Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions.

ITC, Godfrey Phillips shares tank up to 16%: Why are tobacco shares falling todayShares of Godfrey Phillips India Ltd fell sharply in early trade, sliding nearly 16%. Shares of ITC Ltd also came under pressure, falling around 9% during early trade. The stock slipped to about Rs 362.70, touching its 52-week low.
Sensex opens 180 points higher, Nifty above 26,150; ITC down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 104.21 points to 85,324.81, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 28.60 points to 26,158.20 as of 9:25 am.

Stock market holiday today? Check if NSE and BSE are closed for New Year 2026Major international stock markets across China, Hong Kong, Japan, Singapore, France, Germany, the UAE, the UK and the US are closed on New Year's Day.

Extra excise duty on tobacco products, cess on pan masala to take effect February 1The new levies on tobacco and pan masala will be imposed over and above the applicable GST rates. These measures will replace the GST compensation cess, which is currently charged at varying rates on sin products.

Indraprastha Gas Limited reduces piped cooking gas prices in Delhi-NCRThe reduction follows the sector regulator Petroleum and Natural Gas Regulatory Board's (PNGRB) recent overhaul of pipeline tariffs.

Indian economy to clock strong growth despite global headwinds: RBI GovernorRBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra said maintaining financial stability, resilient institutions and prudent regulation remains central to safeguarding the economy from external shocks.

Investment guru Warren Buffett retires today. What's his retirement fund?As Warren Buffett, the Oracle of Omaha, steps aside after turning Berkshire Hathaway into a $1.1 trillion conglomerate, questions turn to how the world's most famous investor will fund life after hanging his boots. With nearly all his $149 billion fortune tied up in Berkshire stock, Buffett's retirement corpus is built on long-term bets, compounding, and an empire he still controls.

Earning Rs 1 crore but can't afford a Rs 5 crore home in Gurgaon? Expert explains whyA Rs 1 crore annual salary sounds more than sufficient to buy a house. Yet, many high earners find themselves priced out of the housing market. Here's what an expert says about the real reasons behind this mismatch.

Holiday vs retirement home: How to decide the purpose of your second propertyMany buyers dream of a second home, but few pause to ask a key question: Is it meant for leisure or for life after work? The answer shapes everything from location and cost to comfort and long-term suitability. Let's have a look.
Sensex ends 545 points higher, Nifty above 26,100; RIL up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 545.52 points to end at 85,220.60, while the NSE Nifty50 added 190.75 points to close at 26,129.60​​​​​​​.

Vodafone Idea gets more time to pay Rs 87,695 crore AGR duesAccording to sources, the AGR dues amounting to Rs 87,695 crore will now be paid over a ten-year period from FY32 to FY41. While the decision eases near-term repayment pressure, it does not involve any waiver, haircut, or reduction in the total dues.

entertainment.headline: Jayasurya denies new ED summons in fraud case, slams media for misinformation Malayalam actor Jayasurya has publicly denied receiving any fresh summons from the Enforcement Directorate, challenging media reports linking him to further questioning in the Save Box App fraud investigation.

Why Dhurandhar released a revised version after muting 'Baloch' reference One of Sanjay Dutt's dialogues in 'Dhurandhar' sparked concerns within the Baloch community, who alleged that it targeted them. Following backlash, the makers of 'Dhurandhar' decided to mute the dialogue.

Tu Meri Main Tera box office Day 8: Kartik film slogs, earns Rs 30 crore in 1st week Kartik Aaryan and Ananya Panday's 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri' has hit a roadblock at the box office amid major new releases. The film failed to capitalise on the festive buzz and struggled to hold its ground at the ticket counters.

Dhurandhar box office Day 29: Rs 15 crore added as film eyes Rs 1,200 crore globally Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar added another Rs 15 crore on New Year to its global collection. The film is now Rs 52 crore behind Jawan's total collection.

George Clooney responds after Donald Trump mocks his French citizenship George Clooney and former US President Donald Trump have renewed their public feud, with Trump mocking Clooney's acquisition of French citizenship. Clooney responded with a sharp retort supporting America's political future.

Not January 2, Thalapathy Vijay's Jana Nayagan trailer to release on this date The production team behind Thalapathy Vijay's final film, Jana Nayagan, has officially announced the trailer's release date and time, generating significant anticipation among fans as the film approaches its January 9 premiere.

Will Smith sued for sexual harassment, ex-tour violinist seeks damages A violinist has filed a civil lawsuit against actor Will Smith and his company, Treyball Studios Management, alleging sexual harassment and wrongful termination after reporting an incident during Smith's 2025 tour.

10 most anticipated Telugu films of 2026: A year of comebacks, risks and big bets After a muted 2025, Telugu cinema is lining up a high-stakes 2026 with star-driven festival releases, ambitious pan-India projects, and multiple comeback vehicles that could reshape box-office momentum.

Javed Akhtar calls out fake AI video, may move cyber police Javed Akhtar has been targeted by a fake AI-generated video falsely attributing a statement to him, which he has strongly denied and condemned. Sharing a post on X, the veteran lyricist has warned of legal action.

Dhurandhar star Akshaye Khanna starts shooting for Telugu debut Mahakali. BTS pics Amid Dhurandhar and Drishyam 3 exit buzz, actor Akshaye Khanna has begun a new chapter in his career – his Telugu debut. Titled Mahakali, the film is being directed by Pooja Kolluru and stars Bhoomi Shetty in the titular role.

Gaurav Khanna rejects claims fame helped him win Bigg Boss 19 After securing victory in Bigg Boss 19, Gaurav Khanna responds to social media claims linking his success to his past association with Colors TV, emphasising his long-standing career and individual efforts.

Arjun Bijlani mourns father-in-law at funeral, shares emotional moment with son Rakesh Chandra Swami, father-in-law of television actor Arjun Bijlani, died at the age of 73 following a sudden stroke. The funeral was held at the Oshiwara crematorium on Thursday, attended by immediate family members.

Meesala Pilla song from Mana Shankara Vara Prasad Garu crosses 100 million views The first single Meesala Pilla from Anil Ravipudi's Mana Shankara Vara Prasad Garu has crossed 100 million views on YouTube, continuing the director's trend of music-led pre-release buzz.

Marco star Unni Mukundan meets BJP's K Annamalai ahead of PM Modi biopic Actor Unni Mukundan, who will portray Narendra Modi in the upcoming film Maa Vande, met senior BJP leader K Annamalai on New Year's Day. The meeting comes as Mukundan prepares to depict Modi's life.

KBC 17: Why Big B teased grandson Agastya over Ikkis co-star Simar's saree trail Agastya Nanda appeared in 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17' alongside his 'Ikkis' co-star Simar Bhatia. Amitabh Bachchan teased his grandson over helping Simar with her saree trail in the show.

The Housemaid review: Amanda Seyfried shines in slow burn that gets under your skinRelease Date:Thu Jan 01, 2026 The newly released film, The Housemaid, is a gripping domestic thriller that explores power and deception in a wealthy household. With strong performances by Amanda Seyfried, Brendon Sklenar and Sydney Sweeney, and a slow-burn tension, it keeps viewers guessing at every turn.

Revised version of Akshaye Khanna's Dhurandhar hits cinemas today The espionage thriller Dhurandhar, directed by Aditya Dhar and starring Ranveer Singh, has released a revised version in cinemas nationwide after the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting ordered changes to certain dialogues and muted words due to political sensitivities.

Is Farhan Akhtar eyeing Rajat Bedi to replace Vikrant Massey in Don 3? Following the departure of several key actors from Farhan Akhtar's anticipated Don 3, discussions are underway with Rajat Bedi to fill a major role after Vikrant Massey's exit. Official confirmation is awaited as casting changes continue ahead of production.

Encouraging, myth-breaking: Trade experts decode 2025 box office, set sights on 2026 The past year broke box office myths, rewarding content and conviction over formula and star power, with films like 'Saiyaara', 'Lokah: Chapter 1' and 'Mahavatar Narsimha'. Experts speak to India Today about the audience-driven shift, along with a strong 2026 slate, promises an exciting future for Hindi cinema.

general news.headline: Contaminated water behind Indore diarrhoea outbreak that killed 9: Lab reportMadhya Pradesh Chief Minister Mohan Yadav described the diarrhoea outbreak as an "emergency-like situation" and assured strict action against those responsible.

Iran on edge as several killed in protests against Ayatollah over ailing economyThe country is witnessing its largest protests in three years over soaring inflation, sparking violence across several regions. Deaths were reported in Lordegan, Kuhdasht, and Isfahan, reflecting the spread of the unrest since shopkeepers began demonstrating over the government's handling of a currency slide and rapidly rising prices.

Hindu man stabbed, set on fire by mob in Bangladesh. 4th such incident in 2 weeksThe businessman, Khokan Chandra, had a narrow escape after he was beaten, stabbed and set on fire by a mob in Bangladesh. He escaped by jumping into a nearby pond, but sustained serious burn injuries.

Live: Delhi shivers as cold wave grips North India, temperatures to further plungeDelhi NCR Weather Live Updates: After light rain on the first day of 2026, Delhi braces for a dip in temperature on January 2. On Thursday, the minimum temperature stood at 10.6 degrees Celsius, and the maximum temperature stood at 17.3 degrees Celsius. The temperature is expected to dip today, with the mercury likely to fall to eight degrees Celsius (minimum) and 16 degrees Celsius (maximum). Follow indiatoday.com for more updates.

Marriage no longer enough to get a US Green Card, says immigration attorneyAn American immigration attorney has recently warned that marriage to an American citizen was no longer a guarantee of getting a US Green Card. For a Green Card, they will need to convince immigration officials that the marriage is genuine. Here's what Brad Bernstein is advising spouses aspiring for a Permanent Resident Card.

Dhurandhar box office Day 29: Rs 15 crore added as film eyes Rs 1,200 crore globallyRanveer Singh's Dhurandhar added another Rs 15 crore on New Year to its global collection. The film is now Rs 52 crore behind Jawan's total collection.

Despite silencing critics, bigger questions await Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma in 2026Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma endured intense scrutiny in 2025 but repeatedly proved their value with standout performances. With limited ODI opportunities this year, the legendary duo will attract even more attention as consistency, competition and age will determine their future in team India.

BJP leader calls Shah Rukh Khan traitor over KKR's induction of Bangladeshi playerKolkata Knight Riders purchased Mustafizur Rahman at the expense of Rs nine crore in the last IPL auction held in December. The move has now triggered a controversy.

Cold wave to intensify in Delhi as temperature dips; air quality improvesWinter chills are set to intensify in Delhi and adjoining NCR areas with cold-wave conditions forecasted. Despite falling temperatures, air quality shows a slight improvement, offering some relief amid concerns.

Venus Williams makes Australian Open comeback at 46Venus Williams will return to the Australian Open at 45 after receiving a wildcard entry. The seven-time Grand Slam champion makes her comeback five years after her last appearance, rewriting age records in Melbourne.

Find everything your baby needs this holiday season on Amazon's Everyday EssentialsAs part of the New Year selections, the specially curated New Year Store —available until 31 December 2025—brings up to 50% off across a wide selection of everyday essentials.

9 km in 2.5 hours, Bihar passenger train delay triggers protestPassengers alleged that the automatic signalling system, introduced to improve efficiency and safety, has instead become a daily source of harassment. Trains are being stopped one after another without proper coordination, resulting in multiple rakes getting trapped between signals with no clear information provided to passengers

Logon ke dil badal gye: Zohran Mamdani to New Yorkers at mayoral inaugurationMamdani, who ran his electoral campaign focusing on issues like rising rents, food prices, and everyday living costs, further emphasised good governance and the betterment of the common New Yorkers' lives during his inaugural speech as the 112th Mayor of New York City.

Next-gen Kia Seltos launched in India at Rs 10.99 lakhKia India has launched the second-generation Seltos at Rs 10.99 lakh (ex-showroom), introducing a larger, more premium and tech-focused midsize SUV aimed at strengthening its position in India's highly competitive segment.

Ashes: Usman Khawaja announces retirement in fiery presser before Sydney TestUsman Khawaja will retire from international cricket after the Sydney Ashes Test against England. The veteran opener confirmed his decision in a blunt press conference, where he also spoke against racial stereotyping he faced during his career.

Retired Air Force officer asks sons to vacate house in UP, they get him killedA retired Indian Air Force officer was shot dead in Ghaziabad after allegedly asking his sons to vacate the house so he could sell the property. Police later revealed that the sons allegedly plotted the murder and hired a contract killer.

Swiss nightclub fire death toll rises to 47, survivors recount horrorThe death toll in the devastating nightclub fire in Switzerland has risen to 47, with more than 100 injured people undergoing treatment. Eyewitnesses described the incident as a horror of unimaginable scale, unlike anything they had ever witnessed before.

Binge Drinking can be more harmful for heart healthBinge drinking may feel festive, but cardiologists warn it can quietly damage the heart, trigger dangerous rhythm disorders, raise blood pressure and increase the risk of heart failure and stroke, sometimes within just one night of excess.

1 killed as BJP, Congress workers clash in Karnataka over tying bannerOne person was killed after clashes erupted between BJP and Congress supporters in Ballari, Karnataka, over the tying of a banner outside an MLA's residence. The situation turned violent with stone-pelting, police lathi-charge, and teargas firing, prompting heavy security deployment.

Are you Bangladeshi? Ghaziabad cops' 'citizenship verification machine' sparks rowA video from Ghaziabad showing police using a purported "citizenship verification machine" on a man and allegedly identifying him as "Bangladeshi" has gone viral on social media.

P Chidambaram defends DMK after Congress leader raises alarm over Tamil Nadu debtCongress leader Praveen Chakravarty's comments flagging Tamil Nadu's debt as "alarming" have triggered sharp backlash within the Congress.

sports.headline: Despite silencing critics, bigger questions await Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma in 2026 Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma endured intense scrutiny in 2025 but repeatedly proved their value with standout performances. With limited ODI opportunities this year, the legendary duo will attract even more attention as consistency, competition and age will determine their future in team India.

Play like Pujara and Rahane: Australian batters receive advice after MCG debacle Former India cricketer Robin Uthappa has urged Australian batters to adopt patience like Cheteshwar Pujara and Ajinkya Rahane on challenging wickets. His advice comes after Australia's heavy collapse during the fourth Test of the Ashes 2025-26 in Melbourne.

Venus Williams makes Australian Open comeback at 46 Venus Williams will return to the Australian Open at 45 after receiving a wildcard entry. The seven-time Grand Slam champion makes her comeback five years after her last appearance, rewriting age records in Melbourne.

BJP Leader Sangeet Som Calls Shah Rukh Khan 'Traitor' For Buying Bangladeshi Cricketer Mustafizur A major political controversy has erupted over Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) acquiring Bangladeshi cricketer Mustafizur Rahman for the IPL. BJP leader Sangeet Som launched a scathing attack on KKR owner Shah Rukh Khan, stating, 'Traitors like Shah Rukh Khan are buying cricket players like Rehman.' Som argued that players from Bangladesh should not be welcomed while Hindus face atrocities there. The Shiv Sena (UBT) also criticized the move, alleging the funds could nurture terrorism. Conversely, Karnataka Minister Priyank Kharge defended the decision, asserting it aligns with BCCI regulations.

Looking ahead: My wishlist for Indian cricket in 2026 2026 is a chance for Indian cricket to grow—fans deserve consistency, honesty, and insight, on and off the field. Here's what I hope the game brings in the year ahead.

Ashes: Usman Khawaja announces retirement in fiery presser before Sydney Test Usman Khawaja will retire from international cricket after the Sydney Ashes Test against England. The veteran opener confirmed his decision in a blunt press conference, where he also spoke against racial stereotyping he faced during his career.

Premier League's dull start to 2026: Man City, Liverpool, Tottenham draw blanks The Premier League stumbled into 2026 as City, Liverpool and Tottenham failed to score on New Year's Day. Wasteful finishing, rigid defending and mounting pressure defined a flat afternoon that subtly shifted momentum elsewhere league.

Australian PM Anthony Albanese hosts Ashes stars ahead of pink Test in Sydney Australian PM Anthony Albanese hosted Australia and England players ahead of the final Ashes Test, joking that teams must ensure the Sydney match reaches day three for Jane McGrath Day.

J&K Police summon cricketer, organiser over Palestine flag at local tournament Jammu and Kashmir Police investigate private cricket event after player displays Palestinian flag, summoning key individuals for clarification.

Nicholas Lee to join as India women's strength and conditioning coach post-WPL 2026 Nicholas Lee is set to take over as strength and conditioning coach of the India women's cricket team after WPL 2026, bringing vast experience from international and franchise cricket.

Clubs ready to restart ISL, but only if 2 conditions are met by AIFF Thirteen ISL clubs have told the AIFF that they are ready to play the league this season if the Indian football body meets certain conditions. The AIFF has been asked to assume full financial responsibility for the league.

So bad they shut it down: Gabon suspend team, axe Aubameyang after AFCON flopGabon's government have suspended the national football team, sacked the coaching staff, and removed Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang and Bruno Ecuele Manga following a disappointing Africa Cup of Nations campaign, according to Reuters.

Damien Martyn's battle with meningitis: Adam Gilchrist provides positive updateFormer Australia cricketer Adam Gilchrist has provided a crucial update on Damien Marytn, who is in a coma. Martyn was admitted to the hospital, fighting the life-threatening disease meningitis.

Enzo Maresca becomes first Premier League manager to be sacked on New Year's DayChelsea parted ways with Enzo Maresca on New Year's Day, making him the first Premier League manager to be sacked on January 1 as the club looks to reset its season.

I was humiliated: Jason Gillespie reveals why he quit Pakistan cricketJason Gillespie revealed he quit as Pakistan's Test coach after just eight months due to strained relations with the PCB, citing poor communication, humiliating decisions, and mixed on-field results during his tenure.

Gautam Gambhir welcomes New Year in London, spends family time with daughtersIndia head coach Gautam Gambhir spent the New Year's in London with his family. Gambhir posted photos from his trip on Instagram.

Stefanos Tsitsipas recalls contemplating retirement in 2025: Couldn't walk for two daysStefanos Tsitsipas says a crippling back injury in 2025 left him unable to walk for days and close to retirement, but pain-free rehabilitation has renewed his confidence and focus on staying healthy in 2026.

Chelsea part ways with Enzo Maresca to get their season back on trackChelsea have confirmed the departure of head coach Enzo Maresca, saying both parties felt a change was needed to get the season back on track amid key objectives still in play.

Ravichandran Ashwin warns ODI cricket could face slow death after 2027 World CupFormer India off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin expresses concerns about the decline of the One-Day International format, citing the influence of T20 cricket, the dominance of star players, and challenges posed by ICC scheduling.

Todd Murphy on competition with Nathan Lyon: Was never going to keep my placeAustralian spinner Todd Murphy has a chance of playing the fifth Ashes Test against England with Nathan Lyon ruled out of the series due to a high-grade right hamstring injury.

Vladimir Kramnik sues FIDE for defamation after Daniel Naroditsky controversyFormer world chess champion Vladimir Kramnik has initiated legal proceedings against FIDE, the world chess governing body, in a Swiss court, following an ethics inquiry into his allegations of cheating among top players after the death of American Grandmaster Daniel Naroditsky.

Mitchell Marsh sends strong warning before T20 World Cup with 55-ball century in BBLMitchell Marsh blasted a career-fastest T20 century off 55 balls for the Perth Scorchers against Hobart Hurricanes in the BBL and sent a warning ahead of the T20 World Cup.

Not upset over IPL snub, Chetan Sakariya focusses on small goals for comebackIndian fast bowler Chetan Sakariya, undeterred by going unsold in the IPL 2026 auction last month and recent domestic struggles, has set small goals to stage a comeback.

Australia name unchanged squad for fifth Ashes Test in SydneyAustralia have named an unchanged 15-member squad for the fifth and final Ashes Test against England, with Steve Smith continuing as captain in Pat Cummins' absence. The fifth Test begins on January 4 at Sydney Cricket Ground.

Babar Azam welcomes 2026 with match-winning 58, Mohammad Rizwan fails againBBL 2025-26: Babar Azam's unbeaten 58 steered Sydney Sixers to a six-wicket win over Melbourne Renegades at the Docklands Stadium, while Mohammad Rizwan struggled again in the Big Bash League.

Sarfaraz can play all 3 formats, a shame that he's being ignored: Former captainFormer India captain Dilip Vengsarkar believes Sarfaraz Khan deserves a place in all formats of the Indian team. Despite consistent domestic performances, he feels Sarfaraz's exclusion raises questions about selection.

After WPL exit, Ellyse Perry shines with match-winning effort in New ZealandAustralia legend Ellyse Perry made an immediate impact after withdrawing from WPL 2026, starring with a key all-round performance to lead Wellington Women to a dominant win in the Women's Super Smash.

England need to win in Sydney for Stokes and McCullum's future: Michael VaughanMichael Vaughan feels England need to win the fifth Test of the ongoing Ashes 2025-26 for Ben Stokes and Brendon McCullum to continue in their respective roles. England are trailing by 1-3 in the five-match series with one game remaining.

MS Dhoni to Cristiano Ronaldo: Some of the greatest athletes could retire in 2026There are men who play sport and there are men who shape it. This year, a significant crop of those trendsetting players could call time on their respective careers.

Chaos at Chelsea: Coach Enzo Maresca likely to leave after fallout with clubChelsea are bracing for another managerial change as tensions with Enzo Maresca reach breaking point. Poor results, internal friction and growing uncertainty have pushed both sides towards an imminent parting of ways.

Mandhana seeks blessings at Mahakaleshwar temple with team India to start 2026Smriti Mandhana visited the Mahakaleshwar temple in Ujjain to offer prayers and attend the Bhasm Aarti on the first day of 2026 along with the Indian women's cricket team.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
